engine.core

Class Display

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Canvas
        • engine.core.Display
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class Display
extends java.awt.Canvas
    Represents a window that can be drawn in using a software renderer.
    Author:
    Benny Bobaganoosh (thebennybox@gmail.com)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Display

        public Display(int width,
       int height,
       java.lang.String title)
        Creates and initializes a new display.
        Parameters:
        width - How wide the display is, in pixels.
        height - How tall the display is, in pixels.
        title - The text displayed in the window's title bar.

    • Method Detail

      • swapBuffers

        public void swapBuffers()
        Presents the user with any new images drawn in the display.

      • getInput

        public Input getInput()
        Gets the Input for this display.
        Returns:
        A reference to the user input received by this display.

      • getContext

        public RenderContext getContext()
        Gets the RenderContext for this display.
        Returns:
        A RenderContext that can draw into this display.
